channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024090217
item.description:
Report E-2024090217

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: BOONVILLE
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, twelve (12) 1-gallon pails of paint fell in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration, LLC (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and swept them in with hand tools. All absorbent waste and product containers were collected and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon drums and transported to the R+L terminal in Kansas City.

item.title: Report E-2024090136
item.description:
Report E-2024090136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 30, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of UN1224 to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental Services (FCE) to remediate the site. When the crew arrived, the product had evaporated and decided no cleanup response was necessary.

item.title: Report E-2024090124
item.description:
Report E-2024090124

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-12T09:14:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-08
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 5-pounds of B-TRAXIM®2C ZN-260 - M60-502 released from (2) paper bags due to improper loading. The release impacted the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with the PPE available on site.

item.title: Report X-2024090406
item.description:
Report X-2024090406

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-11T09:14:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING AT 20:15 HOURS,IN THE SORT AISLE SECTION D OF THE EARTH CITY, MO UPS HUB. THE PACKAGE (A 14X10X11 IN 350LBS BURSTING TEST DOUBLE WALL FIBERBOARD BOX) WAS FOUND WITH THE CARDBOARD SATURATED. AN EXTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO SIGNS OF ABUSE FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS. THE SPILLAGE WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. ALL MATERIAL HAS BEEN PROCESSED THROUGH THE UPS DAMAGED MATERIALS PROGRAM.
